# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(input_string::String, text_width::Int=10)::String
    words = split(input_string)
    result = String[]
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + (isempty(current_line) ? 0 : 1) <= text_width
            current_line *= isempty(current_line) ? word : " " * word
        else
            push!(result, current_line)
            current_line = word
        end
    end
    
    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(result, current_line)
    end
    
    return join(result, "\n")
end

# Example Usage
example_text = "This is an example to demonstrate the word wrapping functionality."
println(wrap_string(example_text, 15))
```

This function will split the input string into words, iteratively build lines respecting the `text_width`, and add new lines when necessary. The example demonstrates the word wrapping with a `text_width` of 15.
